intro: Vincetoxicum arenicola, commonly known as the sand vincetoxicum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Vincetoxicum arenicola is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
